DBLP:conf/icwsm/Reiter-HaasKL21.title: Studying Moral-based Differences in the Framing of Political Tweets
DBLP:conf/icwsm/Reiter-HaasKL21.author:
Markus Reiter{-}Haas and
Simone Kopeinik and
Elisabeth Lex
DBLP:conf/icwsm/Reiter-HaasKL21.paperMotivationText: The goal is to understand differences in framing in (i) English tweets from US politicians and (ii) German tweets related to Covid-19 from Austrian accounts
DBLP:conf/icwsm/Reiter-HaasKL21.paperContributionText: The authors analyze framing by first collecting the two datasets of tweets and then applying a logistic regression classifier that uses features based on the FrameAxis model. For the dataset of German tweets, they automatically translate the MFD-2 using pos/neg valence words and translation matrix based on word embeddings.
DBLP:conf/icwsm/Reiter-HaasKL21.paperResultsText: For US tweets, results are in line with MFT. For German tweets, conservative users emphasize care.
